I have inherited several Java programs with no existing design documents, t=
est cases, or jdocs. I am tackling each of these in turn and now that I hav=
e a better layout and docs I am tackling the lack for test cases. However, =
since these are the first junit test cases I have ever written I am getting=
 stuck.

(1) One program spawns off three threads. One thread moves files i=
nto storage, a second deletes files from storage, and the third catalogs al=
l existing files in the storage. The problem is that each class only expose=
s the constructor and the run() method - so there is really not public faci=
ng methods to check. The run() goes off on its own, doing all kinds of step=
s using private methods, only ending upon death.
	So for example, the Mover=
 thread is checking for files in a given directory, if it finds a file it p=
arses information from the filename to find its destination, them moves the=
 file to that destination. Once it has finished with all of the files it sl=
eeps for a few minutes. I would like to check all of parsing steps, but the=
y are private only.

(2) A second program relies on all of its data in a MS=
 SQL database (connection using jdbc). Is there so way to build a fake set =
of tables using junit so that when run under junit it would get data from a=
 set of objects instead of actually going to the database. That way I can p=
rovide for my own data - both bad and good - and track those results.



Ch=
ip
